question[question_text]: Which of the following statements ARE CORRECT?
question[answers][0][answer_text]: Node impurity measures (such as Gini or Entropy) tend to prefer splits that result in large number of partitions.
question[answers][1][answer_text]: Information Gain is the expected reduction in entropy caused by partitioning the examples according to a given attribute.
question[answers][2][answer_text]: Entropy at a given node t, can have a minimum value of 0.5 - when all records belong to one class - implying most beneficial situation for classification.
question[answers][3][answer_text]: Classification error at a node t has a minimum value of 1-1/c when records are equally distributed among all classes.
